required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enteral Nutrition as Stress Ulcer Prophylaxis in Critically Ill Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: Enteral Nutrition as Stress Ulcer Prophylaxis in Critically Ill Patients. Prospective, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Study.

brief_summary.textblock: study is to determine if proton pump inhibitors plus enteral nutrition is superior to enteral nutrition alone as a stress ulcer prophylaxis strategy in critically ill patients in terms of incidence of overt and significant GI bleeding related to stress gastropathy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With GI Bleeding
primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects will be followed from date of randomization until discharge from the ICU or cessation of Enteral Nutrition (EN) and successful initiation of oral feeds up to 100 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of overt GI bleeding (as defined by the presence of coffee ground emesis, hematemesis of bright red blood, melena, or hematochezia) seen with Proton Pump Inhibitor (PPI) and EN versus EN alone in critically ill patients. Incidence of significant GI bleeding, defined by a 3-point decrease in hematocrit within 24 hours accompanied by signs of overt GI bleeding, or by an unexplained 6-point decrease in hematocrit during any 48 hour period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With ICU-acquired C. Difficile Pseudomembranous Colitis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects will be followed until discharge from the ICU or cessation of EN and successful initiation of oral feeds up to 100 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pantoprazole 40mg IV daily and tube feed

intervention.intervention_name: Pantoprazole 40 mg IV daily and tube feed.
intervention.description: Patients randomized to the control group "active Comparator" will receive tube feed plus an Pantoprazole 40 mg IV daily.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pantoprazole 40mg IV daily and tube feed
intervention.other_name: Tube feed formula:(Vital AF "Advanced Formula" 1.2 Cal(TM),Abbott,Columbus,OH)

intervention.description: Patients randomized to Placebo group "placebo Comparator" will receive tube feed plus an Placebo.
intervention.other_name: Tube feed formula:(Vital AF "Advanced Formula" 1.2 Cal(TM),Abbott,Columbus,OH)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 years or older
- Admission to the medical ICU at University of Louisville Hospital or Jewish Hospital
- Expected need for mechanical ventilation > 48 hours
- No contraindication to EN within the first 24 hours after admission to the ICU
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of active GI bleeding during current hospitalization prior to study entry
- Admission to ICU with primary diagnosis of burn injury
- Closed head injury or increased intracranial pressure
- Partial or complete gastrectomy
- Pregnancy or lactation

clinical_study.keyword: Small peptide fish oil structured lipids

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment started in July 2013 in the medical ICU of University of Louisville Hospital. In July 2014, a second recruitment site (medical ICU at Jewish Hospital) was added as a second site for recruitment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
